meanings.definition: A person who feels or expresses strong disapproval or condemnation.
meanings.sent1: The deplorers shook their heads in disapproval at the litter on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The community labeled them as deplorers for their constant complaints.
meanings.sent3: The deplorers at the meeting sighed dramatically when the proposal was rejected.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a deplorer in a sea of indifference, standing up for what she believed in.
meanings.sent5: The image of the deplorers holding up protest signs will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who are regarded with strong disapproval or condemnation.
meanings.sent1: The deplorers gathered outside the courthouse, attracting attention with their signs.
meanings.sent2: The deplorers were not welcomed by the community due to their controversial beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The deplorers seemed to enjoy being the center of attention, even if it was negative.
meanings.sent4: The deplorers stood out like a sore thumb in the crowd of supporters.
meanings.sent5: The deplorers' presence cast a shadow over the otherwise peaceful protest.
